medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in 1992 with abrupt onset of right-sided hemiplegia and aphasia lasting 3 weeks. In 1994, he had a complex partial seizure and transient left hemiparesis. He experienced recurrent seizures and left-sided hemiparesis in 1996, along with encephalopathy. In the months leading up to admission, he had several attacks of alternating hemiparesis and a single episode of vertigo lasting several days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of neurologic symptoms including seizures, hemiparesis, and encephalopathy; underwent bilateral vitrectomy in 1995 for presumed vitritis.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandfather developed seizures and progressive dementia in mid-fifties; father (Patient II-2) had episodes of aphasia, alternating hemiparesis, and eventually died due to dementia.
